Description:
Detects inline Windows shell commands redirecting output via the ">" symbol to a suspicious location.
This technique is sometimes used by malicious actors in order to redirect the output of reconnaissance commands such as "hostname" and "dir" to files for future exfiltration.


Author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Potentially Suspicious CMD Shell Output Redirect
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where ((process_path like '%\cmd.exe' and original_file_name = 'cmd.exe') and ((command like '%>?%appdata%\%' or command like '%>?%temp%\%' or command like '%>?%tmp%\%' or command like '%>?%userprofile%\%' or command like '%>?c:\programdata\%' or command like '%>?c:\temp\%' or command like '%>?c:\users\public\%' or command like '%>?c:\windows\temp\%') or ((command like '% >%' or command like '%">%' or command like '%'>%') and (command like '%c:\users\%' and command like '%\appdata\local\%'))))
